About Me

Hi, I’m Anu and I’m a Junior, studying Computer Science at the School of Computing (SoC) at the National University of Singapore (NUS). I am also studying in a parallel academic programme, the University Scholars’ Programme (USP) at NUS.

I intend to focus in Computer Graphics, Artificial Intelligence and Information Retrieval. I’m also extremely passionate about and have experience in film-making and theatre productions.

The tools I am proficient in are Java, C++, OpenGL, JavaScript, Python, HTML & CSS, and C.

I’m also competent in Film and Stage Direction, Screenwriting and Playwriting, Post-production for film and Stage Management.

I have also recently picked up Maya.

Education

National University of Singapore

BComp Computer Science + University Scholars' Programme

2017 - 2021

Key courses I have taken at NUS include Computer Graphics, Artificial Intelligence, Media Computing, Information Retrieval, and Playwriting.

I am an active member of USP Productions and nuStudios, which are theatre and film interest groups respectively at NUS.

Stanford University

Computer Science + International Honors' Program (IHP)

Jun 2019 - Aug 2019

I completed a summer semester at Stanford University. The courses I took were Design and Analysis of Algorithms & Principles of Computer Systems.

The University of Texas at Austin

Computer Science

Aug 2019 - Dec 2019

I completed a semester abroad at The University of Texas at Austin. The courses I took were Software Engineering, General Physics I, Digital Media Production and 3D Animation.

Experience

Zendesk

Software Engineer Intern

Jan 2020 - July 2020

I am currently working as a Software Engineer Intern at Zendesk.

Quantum Inventions, a subsidiary of Continental Automotive

Graphics Engineer Intern and Vlogger

May 2019 - June 2019

I worked as a Graphics Engineer Intern at Quantum Inventions, a subsidiary of Continental AG. I developed Douglas-Peucker, Rheumann-Whitkam and Visvalingam-Whyatt line simplification algorithms for map rendering in C++ on Android Studio.

Projects

Static Program Analyser (SPA)

Designed, developed and built a medium sized C++ application that statistically analyses and queries program code. Primarily worked on parsing source code, extracting and storing relevant design abstractions, and writing system tests.

Graphics Rendering Techniques (C++)

Developed OpenGL (v4.3) projects covering normal, procedural bump, reflection, and projective texture mapping, whitted and distributed ray tracing, and radiosity.

OpenGL projects (C++)

Developed OpenGL (v2.1) projects covering animation, illumination and shading, bezier curves and ray tracing.

Artificial Intelligence Poker Player (Python)

Developed a poker player for modified version of Limit Texas Hold’em, implementing novel heuristics, and trained the agent using reinforcement learning.

Audio Steganography (Matlab)

Developed an steganography application which embeds text messages into a music file for secure message transfer.

Information Retrieval Engine (Python)

Developed a search engine application for text-based retrieval.

Portfolio

The Accident

The Accident is a short film made with some friends. The story is a thriller about insurance fraud. I was the Director of Photography on the production. My role entailed creating the shot list and handling the camera during filming. The film is currently in post-production.

SMTWTFS

SMTWTFS is an 80-page play about the struggles that patients face in the diagnosis and initial treatent of autoimmune diseases, through the voice of the protagonist, Mia. The play showcases the inefficacies and strengths of the healthcare system in Singapore, and also the impact the diagnosis of an illness can have on the different relationships the patient has with her family and friends.

Maya Demo Reel

youtu.be/hGXRnT0cl1I>

Created a demo reel of all the mini-projects I made in the 3D Animation course I took at University of Texas at Austin. The course was an introduction to Maya.

Demo Reel 2019

youtu.be/RRdj6Z8Yvlk>

Short demo reel of projects completed before 2019. The demo reel includes clips from the short films Happy Birthday, Reverie, Transit and Reminisce, and also some simple OpenGL (v2.1) projects.

Happy Birthday

Happy Birthday is a film under nuStudios. I was the Assistant Director on the production. It is selected for the Frameworks Film Festival 2019. Snippets of the film are showcased in the nuStudios 2019 showreel.

Sixty-One

Sixty-One is a play by USP Productions. I was the Director on the production and led a cast and crew of 50 members. This play was be staged for the public for 3 nights in late January 2019. Sixty-One explores the issue of accountability, as we follow an AI robot who has been accused of a crime.

In addition to directing, my role also entailed running casting auditions and crew interviews, selecting the script, editing the script and plot, writing in lights, SFX and VFX cues and supervising the technical crew. I also produced some of the VFX clips for the performance.

Reverie

https://goo.gl/YnyvPe>

Reverie is a 37-minute film made for NUS USP Freshman Orientation Camp. The film was split into two parts, Renaissance and Reminisce, and was screened in a series of clips over the course of two camps. I was the Director, Screenwriter, Editor and Colorist on the production.

I led a cast and crew with over 15 members. In addition to directing, I supervised and trained the crew, lined the script, blocked and choreographed scenes, created a shot-list, edited the script, edited the film and colored the shots.

Transit

youtu.be/M3lsDXYmo-M>

Transit is a short film made for a 52 hour film competition ‘Point and Shoot 2018’. I was the Producer and Editor for this film.

I co-wrote the script, organised the shot list, lined the script, helped to manage schedule, edited the film and colored the shots.

Transit was also given an Honourable Mention at the Frameworks Film Festival 2018.

The Dark Web

The Dark Web is a play by USP Productions. I was the Stage Manager of the production. This play was staged for the public for 3 nights in February 2018.

My role as Stage Manager entailed running rehearsals, supervising technical crew comprising stage lights, SFX and VFX, editing lights, SFX and VFX cues, plotting stage lights and running the performances.

Reminisce

youtu.be/VZDq8WlfLgo>

Reminisce was the first film I made after attending nuStudios’ semester long film school. I was the Sound Designer and Editor for this film. My roles entailed editing script, editing film, sourcing music and sound design. Reminisce won best film in nuStudios’ Film School 2017 final showcase, and is also showcased in their showreel.

Volunteer Work

PAP Community Foundation Centre

Lesson Planner, Tutor, Volunteer

January 2017 - June 2018

I volunteered at a local community foundation center to teach underpriviledged students, aged 7-13, computing. I am especially proud of a course I developed and led, teaching young students (ages 7 to 10) higher order thinking through film. The course was titled HOTShots (Higher Order Thinking).

In addition to this, I planned a course on Machine Learning, after which the students (ages 10 to 12) participated in a hackathon. I have also tutored in various other courses which taught the students things such as Scratch and Robotics.

In my spare time

Like most, I spend most of my spare time binging netflix. I have a list in the triple digits of films, shows and plays I need to watch, podcasts I need to listen to, and books I have to read. You’d think having a list gives me a goal, but for every item ticked, five more are added.

My guilty pleasres include watching reruns of Gilmore Girls. I’ve watched it over more times than I can count and please don’t make me pick between Lorelai or Rory (but if you must… Lorelai).

I like making time for off screen hobbies as well. I’ve enjoyed folding orgami since I can remember. I write letters to my friends instead of e-mails cause there’s something really nice about receiving a hand-written note. Pro-tip: it’s also a great way to (i) get addresses for surprise deliveries and (ii) stay in touch with friends you haven’t spoken to in a long time. Sending a letter is never awkward.

I play the drums, which is pretty fun. I’ve also learnt how to DJ, though I suppose that probably would involve some screen time.

But also, I crave adventure. Usually, adventure takes the form of travel, and I am lucky to have had the opportunity to visit places such as Boston, Paris, London, Thailand, India, China, Australia, and more. I really do hope that I find myself embarking on more grand adventures. Mini-adventures within Singapore are also refreshing escapes from the ordinary.

Above all, I really love talking about anything and everything - so, drop me an e-mail :)
